statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -1 \\ -8 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ -3 \\ 7 \\ 8 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -8 \\ -1 \\ -8 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ -3 \\ 7 \\ 8 \end{array}\right].
